content.description: Climb the corner crack to a wider diagonal crack.  Move left and up to a thin face and thin, marginal gear. Reach the horizontal pockets, then climb up the face to a good stance for the anchor.
content.location: On the arête right of Spice of Life. Shares the same anchor as Sphinx Crack. Rappel down from the Spot On! anchor to set up a top rope.

content.description: Climb the double-crack formation while mastering jams and getting stoked on the route!
content.location: Start low on easy the slab at the left facing corner.

content.description:
Climb the easy cracks on the slab to the headwall. Climb the thin, pumpy crack and then head up the face to a wider crack with great jams. Then head up and left to a good stance for the anchor. 

  Set up a toprope or clean the anchor by rappelling and traversing from the anchor above Pirahna.

Start on the face and traverse right on the rail. Give a good spot for the moves protected by thin gear while moving to the left-facing corner. Climb the corner to the overhang. Traverse left and then top out.
content.protection: Gear to 3” plus offset brass (HB #5) to protect the moves to the left-facing corner.
content.location: Start on the face to the right of the blocky corner.

content.description: Climb a burning line of face cracks that offer bomber pro when needed and then demand heated commitment! Endurance and crimp strength required on one of the hottest lines at Pinnacle!
content.location: Downhill from Spot On! Rap down from the anchor of Spot On! to set up a toprope.

content.description: Climb the easy crack on the slab to the headwall. Decipher the crack problem and then continue up the face to a good stance for the anchor.
content.protection: Gear to 1.5" Small nuts and narrow .75 cams
content.location: Around the corner from Sunnyside Arete.

content.description: Start at the broken corner and climb up the ledge. Follow the left-facing crack system. Traverse left on the upper crack and top out. A great route for beginners, but it is not a beginner lead.
content.protection: Gear to 1.5" plus larger for the gear anchor at top.
content.location: This is the first vertical face along the descent to the main area.

content.description: Climb the thin crack and face holds to the top. Don’t let this one scare you!
content.location: Same start as Stokemaster, but traverse right to start of the steeper slab.

content.description: Tape up or get chewed up! Climb the easy slab to the headwall below the large right-facing ramp of Easy Street. Climb the short crack to the Easy Street ledge. Jam up the vertical cracks above to the anchor stance. Go to the top of the slab to finish or set up a toprope at the stance.
content.location: art up the easy slab to the headwall with a vertical crack (left of Easy Street ramp).

content.description: Mount the ledge then climb into the chimney and employ escape artist techniques to reach the top!. Anchor: Gear anchor above the chimney.
content.location: Start on the right side of the large block. Gear anchor above the chimney.

content.description: Climb the easy corner/crack up to the headwall with two cracks. Use both to climb up to a sidepull on the right, then climb up to the cracks above to the anchor.
content.location: Start at the wide slab crack right of the Sphinx Crack.

content.description: Climb the easy slab to the headwall. Plug in gear, and then traverse left up the breakdown (without much gear, to the large right-facing corner. Climb the corner until you can traverse right to a gear anchor.
content.location: Start up the easy slab to the headwall with a sloping ramp.

content.description: Another fun, finger-eating crack climb on the slab!
content.location: Same start as Piranha. From the Easy Street ledge, move right to follow a separate crack.

content.description: Wanna pick a fight? Start at the left facing corner then traverse left to a hollow flake (passive gear only).  Climb up to the roof, with good, small cams, then fight your way up the crack to the ledge above. Place a gear anchor at the ledge, or continue up the remaining slab.
content.protection: Gear to 1.5" with extra finger sized cams.
content.location: From Slip and Slide, don’t slide down the slab! Step away from the wall and down the blocks until you can hike left. Follow the rough path to the base of the 50-foot wall.

content.description: Climb the 5.7 left-facing corner to a ledge. Climb into the dark, wide chimney (5.2) with minimal gear. Preserve the ancient hollow flakes in the gallery. Tunnel through the back of the chimney and emerge from the earth! Anchor: Tree (pad to protect).
content.location: Same start as Bare Knuckle Boxer.

content.description: The Spot has the best concentration and diversity of climbing at Pinnacle Ridge. Crack lines, testy face climbing, pumpy overhangs, and dark chimneys are found here!
